Braves starting pitchers have allowed three runs or fewer in 20 straight games, extending their longest single-season streak since the mound was moved to its current distance in 1893.
The Phillies won the regular season series 3-1 against the Braves.
With losses in two of the first three games of the four-game series, the Braves have fallen six games behind the first-place Phillies in the National League East.
The Phillies increased their lead over the Braves in the division to six games.
The game had a sellout crowd of 42,730.
All-Star third baseman Alec Bohm did not play due to a hand injury.
Phillies reliever José Alvarado returned to the team after being placed on the restricted list for a personal matter.
Philadelphia reinstated left-handed reliever José Alvarado from the restricted list after the game.
The game was held at Citizens Bank Park with an attendance of 42,730.
The game lasted 2 hours and 16 minutes.
The Phillies paid respects to Johnny Gaudreau and Matthew Gaudreau, who were killed by a suspected drunk driver.
